User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 SUSE/3.6.13-0.2.1 Firefox/3.6.13
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101206 SUSE/3.1.7 Lightning/1.0b2 Thunderbird/3.1.7

When a network calendar looses connectivity and the calendar is toggled then events from all calendars (not just the calendar that looses connectivity) disappear from the Day/Week/Multiweek/Month calendar view.  Note that the other calendar's events remain i the event list view, even though they are not displayed in the other view,

This situation occurs under certain conditions:
* Thunderbird/Lightning started online and looses connectivity
* Thunderbird has NOT been in an offline condition prior to the connectivity loss
* Connectivity remains broken

The two ways I was able to reproduce this were to either:
* Enter an incorrect password for the CalDAV (Google) site
* disconnect the computer from the network

Not also that this issue does not occur in WIndows.  The behavior is different, instead of disappearing permanently, the events return after a short period of time has elapsed (presumabely after a new work connection timeout.

The error message displayed in linux error console is:
Warning: There has been an error reading data for calendar: Google CalDAV.  However, this error is believed to be minor, so the program will attempt to continue. Error code: DAV_NOT_DAV. Description: The resource at https://www.google.com/calendar/dav/kenthatcher@gmail.com/events is either not a DAV collection or not available

Note that an error message does not display in windows for this situation


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Start Thunderbird in "online" mode with multiple calendars and at least one a caldav
2.display calendar tab with day/month/multiday/month and "AllEvents" list and events displayed from multiple calendars
3. Disconnect computer from network
4. Toggle the checkmark next to the caldav Calendar
Actual Results:  
All events disappear and do not return until:

1) Thunderbird is reloaded
2) The connectivity issue is resolved and the day/week/multiweek/month pane is reloaded

Individual events will redisplay if they are edited and saved from the event list pane.

Note also that if I take Thunderbird offline prior to losing network connectivity, this issue does not occur

Expected Results:  
All events display with the network events showing the last know good status before disconnection.  Note that this could be an absence of events (for the disconnected calendar only).

This seems to work in the windows version (see description)

While this bug is not a "Major" bug, it is very serious, since the non display of appointments could cause users to miss events.  This will cause people to lose their faith in Lightning and stop using it.
comments.creator: kctcom@juno.com
